sentences.sContent: Draw a straight line across the top of the page.
sentences.sCn: 在这一页的上方画一条直线。

sentences.sContent: Sign your name on the dotted line (= line made up of a series of dots ).
The edges of the pitch are marked by white lines.
The goalkeeper just managed to stop the ball going over the line.
sentences.sCn: 守门员刚好把球截住，没有让它越过球门线。

sentences.sContent: He raced towards the finishing line.
The four men were standing in a line on the other side of the table.
sentences.sCn: 那四个男人在桌子的另一边站成一排。

sentences.sContent: Light travels in a straight line.
A boat came into my line of vision (= direction I was looking in ).
sentences.sCn: 一艘船进入了我的视线。

sentences.sContent: ...but they are just the latest in a long line of animals that have been found to have abilities to help humans...
...In line with a survey conducted by authorities concerned on the web...
...Its "McCafe" line now accounts for an estimated 6% of sales in America...
...You should decide on the best choice and mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 2 with a single line through the centre...
...So you can't tell how the person on the line is reacting...
...there's little reason to uproot to another state and be the last in line for a low-paying job at a new auto plant or a green-energy startup...
...on the best choice and mark the corresponding batter on Answer Sheet 2 with a single line through the centre...
...Please mark the corresponding letter for each item on Answer Sheet 2 with a single line through the centre...

phrases.pCn: adv. 协调；成一直线；有秩序
处于危险中；模棱两可；在电话线上
生产线；产品线；产品系列
不协调，不一致；不成直线
精确地,准确地,正确地 [亦作 by line and level]

trans.tranOther: a long thin mark on a piece of paper, the ground, or another surface
